concept.title: Tag management Quick Start
concept.shortdesc: This section contains an overview of the tasks required to deploy tag management.

row.entry: Define a tag container to provide analytics on your website.
Add support for products, Genesis integrations, and affiliate beacons to the tag container.
Save bookmarklets that let you switch between the dev, state, and live environments to test your tag container.
Add tag management page code to each page on your website.
Set up your workflow to test and promote tag container versions.

section.title: Create a New Container
section.p: The first step is to define a tag container in the Admin interface. A tag container is associated with a digital property.

section.title: Define Tags
section.p: After you create a new tag container, the Edit Tags page displays. This page is where you add product tags and add any custom code.
Keep the following key concepts in mind as you create and deploy a tag container:

ul.li: Tag containers are hosted on a CDN. Each time a new revision is deployed it takes several minutes to propagate to the edge nodes.

Tag Containers are optimized to use asynchronous loading where possible to improve performance. If variables are not being populated or resources are not being found, make sure the code is inserted in the correct location or if necessary, switch to synchronous loading.
Each tag container has a dev, stage, and live environment. New tag containers are created with a dev version only. You must set a cookie to load the dev version. See .

section.title: Copy Environment Bookmarklets
section.p: To test each version of the tag as it moves from dev, stage, and live, copy the bookmarklets from the Environment Overview page. See for additional details.

section.title: Include the Page Code on Site Pages
section.p: Place the page code directly after the <body> tag on site pages.

Variables and other properties are set in the UI in the Tag Code or in the On Load section of the tag container. If you include code that is dependent on tag code outside of the tag manager interface, code must be wrapped in .

section.p: The custom page code for each Tag Container is available in the interface by clicking Get Page Code.

section.title: Test and Promote Revisions
section.p: When you are ready, use the links in the Actions column to copy a revision to the next environment. The current version in Live Environment is sent to users when they view a page that includes the tag loader.
